item.title: Comment on How to install and configure TASM on Windows 7/8/10.Â by Shreyas Jejurkar
item.dc:creator: Shreyas Jejurkar
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://shreyasjejurkar.github.io/testwebsite/2017/03/27/how-to-install-and-configure-tasm-on-windows-7810/#comment-136">JHAM</a>.
There is way to avoid that, but for simplicity I didn’t mentioned that. Here what I do generally, write a program, copy that file in to tasm folder and then open command prompt there and execute it with commands which I have mentioned in blog post above!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to JHAM.

There is way to avoid that, but for simplicity I didn’t mentioned that.
Here what I do generally, write a program, copy that file in to tasm folder and then open command prompt there and execute it with commands which I have mentioned in blog post above!

item.title: Comment on How to install and configure TASM on Windows 7/8/10.Â by Shreyas Jejurkar
item.dc:creator: Shreyas Jejurkar
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://shreyasjejurkar.github.io/testwebsite/2017/03/27/how-to-install-and-configure-tasm-on-windows-7810/#comment-134">Jcail</a>.
Yes. As I highlighted in screenshot, timer.asm is my actual program file. That I pass to compiler and run it. To execute a program, you need to write down in file and pass it to compiler to run it!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jcail.

Yes. As I highlighted in screenshot, timer.asm is my actual program file. That I pass to compiler and run it. To execute a program, you need to write down in file and pass it to compiler to run it!

item.description: Hi, where did the time.asm came from, I just wondering, do I have to make one, what if I have no file but does it will affect the program? thank you.
item.content:encoded: Hi, where did the time.asm came from, I just wondering, do I have to make one, what if I have no file but does it will affect the program? thank you.
